info.title: Network Intelligence APIs
info.description: **MarlinDT Network Intelligence** provides analytical and prediction insights for telecommunications infrastructure and services.

get.summary: Return either JSON or YAML OpenAPI definition
Returns a simple status response about the operational state of MNI (readiness)
Returns a simple resource statistics held in MNI
Get default Map render URL details for UI usage

patch.summary: Update aspects of a single alert

type.description: is only included when purpose is `unclassified`

get.summary: List known and impacting CVEs for specified NE
List all CVE for known vendors

202.description: OK but CVE already existed and was not updated

post.summary: Subscribe to one or more alerts

callbackUrl.description: fully qualified callback URL of the subscribing endpoint to receive the HTTP POST callback, example `https://10.72.23.21/reply`

retries.description: maximum retries in any single alert callback

maxLifeRetries.description:
maximum number of permitted retry attempts for the entire life of this request, *note*:
  when exceeded this callback alert will be automatically deleted

delete.summary: Unsubscribe from one or more alerts

post.summary: Publish one or more alerts to Kafka broker

publicationId.description: unique alert publication identifier for the publishing endpoint - this is required to unpublish from the alert

post.summary: notify one or more alerts to Email recipient

notificationId.description: unique alert notification identifier for the notifying endpoint - this is required to unnotify from the alert

post.summary: Assign one or more alerts to a workflow runner

requestorId.description: unique identifier of the requesting originator

workflowRunnerId.description: unique alert workflow runner identifier for the alert - this is required to unassign from alert from the workflow runner

delete.summary: Unassign one or more alerts from a workflow runner
Remove item from internal alert queue

get.summary: Returns next item awaiting processing from internal alert queue

mgmtIP.description:
- **IPv4 Address** - The quad notation of IPv4, also known as dotted quad or dotted decimal notation, is a way to write IP addresses as four groups of decimal numbers separated by periods. *Example: 192.0.2.146*
- **IPv6 Address** - The quad notation of an IPv6 address is the representation of an IPv6 address as four hexadecimal digits, or *hextets*, in each of eight groups separated by colons. *Example: 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334*

config.description: CLI, JSON or XML (NETCONF/YANG) configuration, *note*: is stored automatically in compressed format

query.description:
case insensitive query phrase specified with search, *note*: wildcards can also be included:
  - `_` pattern matches single character
  - `%` pattern matches any sequence of zero or more characters
*example*: searching for resources containing `abc`
- query:`a%` result:`found`
- query:`_b_` result:`found`
- query:`c` result:`not found`
- query:`c%` result:`not found`
- query:`%c` result:`found`
- query:`abc` result:`found`

resource.description: internal MNI resource type of the matching resource

id.description: internal MNI identifier of the matching resource

post.description: Find the matching ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 three-letter country code that contains the supplied coordinate

ianaMimeType.description: IANA approved list of MIME types

aggregationUnit.description: unit of measure of the aggregation factor

coordinate3d.description:
A geometry is represented using geometric constructs defined as lists of one or more XYZ points forming a three-dimensional geometry. *note*:
- `X` is the longitude with a range of -180 to +180 with scale 3 and precision 6
- `Y` is latitude with a range of -90 to +90 with scale 2 and precision 6
- `Z` scale 8 and precision 2

coordinate.description:
A geometry is represented using geometric constructs either defined as lists of one or more XY or XYZ points or defined parametrically, for example, as a circular arc. While geometry typically is two- or three-dimensional, it may also contain the measurement dimension (M) to provide the basis for dynamic segments. *note*:
- `X` is the longitude with a range of -180 to +180 with scale 3 and precision 6
- `Y` is latitude with a range of -90 to +90 with scale 2 and precision 6
- `Z` scale 8 and precision 2

m.description: extra axis of information not associated with the cartesian x/y/z space

date.description:
MNI date format in compressed ISO-8601. (`YYYYMMDD`)
- `YYYY` 4-digit year
- `MM` 2-digit month (with leading zeros < 10)
- `DD` 2-digit day (with leading zeros if < 10)
- example:
  - `20241118` 18-NOV-2024

dateTime.description:
MNI date format in compressed ISO-8601. (`YYYYMMDDThhmmss`)
- `YYYY` 4-digit year
- `MM` 2-digit month (with leading zeros < 10)
- `DD` 2-digit day (with leading zeros if < 10)
- literal `T` time start indicator
- `hh` 2-digit hours (with leading zero if < 10)
- `mm` 2-diigt minutes (with leading zero if < 10)
- `ss` 2-digit seconds (with leading zero if < 10)
- example:
  - `20241118T150800` 18-NOV-2024 15:08:00

ductPlacement.description: horizontal and vertical placement of the duct within the trench

vertical.description:
measured vertical position from top of trench, for the United Kingdom (GB) this is typically:
  - `power`:
      - Low Voltage 450mm
      - High Voltage 450mm to 1200mm
  - `coax` 250mm to 350mm
  - `gas` 600mm
  - `water` 750mm
  - `ethernet/fiber optic` etc. 350mm

horizontal.description:
measured horizontal position from edge of trench, for the United Kingdom (GB) this is typically:
  - `power` 450mm
  - `coax` 745mm
  - `gas` 1040mm
  - `water` 1310mm
  - `ethernet/fiber optic` etc. 1579mm

dimensions.description: Height x Width x Depth of the item with a specified unit of measure

depthClassifier.description: summary of depth of the trench

heightClassifier.description: summary of height of the (telegraph) pole

durationUnit.description: unit of measure of the duration

portName.description: the name of the network equipment interface port

portMacAddress.description: the Media Access Control (MAC) address of the equipment interface port, i.e. 54:1e:56:e3:55:00, 54-1f-56-e3-55-00, 54:1E:56:E3:55:00 or 54-1E-56-E3-55-00

portConnection.description: cable connection of the interface port, *note*: technology specific

portMultiFiberConnection.description: multi-fiber cable specific ribbon and specific strand

portConfiguration.description: configuration of the interface port, *note*: technology specific

low.description: minimum frequency range of the coaxial port

high.description: maximum frequency range of the coaxial port

mode.description:
mode of the strand
- `SMOF` single-mode optical fiber
- `MMOF` multimode optical fiber

areaType.description:
- `residential`
- `rural`
- `industrial`
- `mixed` - combination of residential/industrial/commercial.
- `psz` - Public Safety Zone
- `urban` 
- `unclassified` - not recorded or known
- `utility` - public service building, i.e. hospital, school

delete.description: MNI internal metadata field to indicate record is marked for deletion

source.description:
MNI internal metadata field used to determine if value was supplied or
generated via machine learning predictive algorithms
- `historical` - value was supplied
- `planned` - value was supplied as possibility or to become
- `predicted` - value was generated

probability.description:
Is a measure of the likelihood that an resource will occur as described. 
It's a value between `0` and `1`, where `0` indicates impossibility and `1` indicates certainty.
*note*: fixed to 2 decimal places
- for `historical` records this is expected to be `1` i.e. 100%
- for `predicted` records this is typically to be `0.25` i.e. 25%
- for `planned` records this will vary based on the planned record itself

searchResourceType.description: internal MNI resource type to search, *note*: `*` will perform the search across all supported resource types

siteType.description:
- `adu` - accessory dwelling units 
- `colo` - colocation
- `commercial` - place of work, retail unit etc.
- `dc` - data center
- `exchange` - district/town exchange building etc.
- `mdu` - multi-dwelling unit
- `pop` - point of presence
- `sdu` - single dwelling unit
- `street` - various street furniture options
- `unclassified` - not recorded or known

cableConfiguration.description: configuration of the cable, *note*: technology specific

twistedPairs.description: number of twisted-pairs within the cable

low.description: minimum frequency range of the coaxial cable

high.description: maximum frequency range of the coaxial cable

mode.description:
mode of the strand
- `SMOF` single-mode optical fiber
- `MMOF` multimode optical fiber

mode of the strand
- `SMOF` single-mode optical fiber
- `MMOF` multimode optical fiber

cableSingleFiberCapacityState.description: State capacity for single fiber optic cable

cableMultiFiberCapacityState.description: State capacity for multi-fiber optic cable

ductPurpose.description: intended contents of the duct, *note*: `cable` means telecommunications cables including `coax`,`copper` for twisted-pair copper cable,`ethernet`,`fiber` etc.

polePurpose.description: intended purpose of the contents carried between (telegraph) poles

managementProtocol.description: protocol used to read and/or write the configuration or operational state of the network equipment

secretScope.description: scope identifier of the authorization credential

secretRealm.description: realm identifier of the authorization credential

secretType.description:
type of the authorization credential that is to be managed, *note*:
- `identity` for OAuth2.0/OIDC style secrets
- `plain` for simple username/password style secrets
- `snmp` for v1, v2c and v3c SNMP style secrets
- `ssh` for SSH key-based with optional certificate style secrets
- `token` for RESTful style API authorization style secrets

secretSnmpV1V2c.description: SNMP v1 or v2c style credential

snmpVersion.description: SNMP version, *note*: `v1` and `v2c` use community strings, where as `v3` uses authorization and encryption protocols for authentication

secretSsh.description: SSH style credential with optional host certificate authority (CA)

private.description: non binary Base64 encoded PKCS#12 or PEM certificate

ca.description: optional non binary Base64 encoded certificate authority (CA)

serviceType.description:
intended offering of the suppplied service, *note*: 
  - `broadband` includes residential offerings such as xDSL and DOCSIS
  - `sogea` is Single Order Generic Ethernet Access which is replacing traditional broadband offerings
  - `fttx` includes FTTC, FTTH, FTTP andd other variants
  - `ethernet` is wholesale or enterprise point-to-point ethernet connectivity
  - `optical` is layer 1 connectivity
  - `voice` is the traditional required extra voice telephony service offered with `broadband`

trenchPurpose.description: intended purpose of the contents of the trench

rackSlots.description: number of physical slots in the rack, 1=1U, 42=42U etc.

channels.description: maximum number of channels within the frequency range

channel.description: channel number within the frequency range

strands.description: strands within each ribbon of the fiber optic cable

emailSend.description: outbound host, credentials and protocol used to send email

username.description: username of used to send email against, typically the assigned email address itself

password.description: password, application specific passphrase or other passphrase used to authenticate with the receiving service

emailReceive.description: inbound host, credentials and protocol used to receive email

username.description: username of used to send email against, typically the assigned email address itself

password.description: password, application specific passphrase or other passphrase used to authenticate with the receiving service

rootFolder.description: Root folder or IMAP path prefix of the specified email account,**warning**: only specify if the host provider provides explicit instructions to do so

folderSeparator.description: folder separator, **warning**: only include if the host provider provides explicit instructions to do so

requestorId.description: unique identifier of the requesting originator

sizeUnit.description:
unit of measure of the dimension:
- `cm` metric centimetres
- `mm` metric millimetres
- `m` metric metres
- `km` meric kilometres
- `Mm` metric megametres
- `inch` imperial inches
- `feet` imperial feet

rackSlotPosition.description: comma separated rack slot number in the range 1..58

kafkaProducerId.description: internal stream broker identifier of the Kafka broker

kafkaProducer.description: outbound host, credentials and protocol used to send stream

password.description: password, application specific passphrase or other passphrase used to authenticate with the receiving service

port.description:
port number of Kafka broker
- `9092` standard port
- `9093` standard TLS encrypted port
- `9094` TLS encrypted port on AWS Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka

acks.description:
When the Kafka producer (i.e. MNI) waits for acknowledgement to prevent data loss.
- `all` producer gets acknowledgement when all in-sync replicas have received record
- `leader` producer gets acknowledgement after leader received record
- `none` producer never gets acknowledgement

linger.description: time to wait in milliseconds before sending current batch

batchSize.description: max size of each batch of records in megabytes (MB)

bufferMemory.description: size of memory in megabytes (MB) to use per buffer

compressionMethod.description: *note*: `lz4` and `snappy` compression codecs are not supported

subscriptionId.description: unique alert subscription identifier for the subscribing endpoint - this is required to unsubscribe from the alert

username.description: username of to connect to engine

password.description: service password, application specific passphrase or other passphrase used to authenticate with the workflow engine

flowName.description: external identifier or name of the workflow

workflowEngineId.description: internal identifier of the workflow engine

vlanId.description:
Virtual LAN (VLAN) identifier, *note*: values `0` and `4095` are generanlly considered reserved.
- `C-VLAN` also known as Customer VLAN identifier
- `S-VLAN` alsp known as Service Provider VLAN identifier

vxlanId.description: Virtual Exensible LAN (VXLAN) identifier, *note*: values `0` and `4095` are generanlly considered reserved

channel.name: channel
channel.description: channel number within the frequency range

dateTime.name: point
dateTime.description:
MNI date format in compressed ISO-8601. (`YYYYMMDDThhmmss`)
- `YYYY` 4-digit year
- `MM` 2-digit month (with leading zeros < 10)
- `DD` 2-digit day (with leading zeros if < 10)
- literal `T` time start indicator
- `hh` 2-digit hours (with leading zero if < 10)
- `mm` 2-diigt minutes (with leading zero if < 10)
- `ss` 2-digit seconds (with leading zero if < 10)
- example:
  - `20241118T150800` 18-NOV-2024 15:08:00

dateFrom.name: from
dateFrom.description:
range start date format in compressed ISO-8601. (`YYYYMMDD`)
- `YYYY` 4-digit year
- `MM` 2-digit month (with leading zeros < 10)
- `DD` 2-digit day (with leading zeros if < 10)
- example:
  - `20241118` 18-NOV-2024

dateTo.name: to
dateTo.description:
range end date format in compressed ISO-8601. (`YYYYMMDD`)
- `YYYY` 4-digit year
- `MM` 2-digit month (with leading zeros < 10)
- `DD` 2-digit day (with leading zeros if < 10)
- example:
  - `20241118` 18-NOV-2024

dateBefore.name: before
dateBefore.description:
before date format in compressed ISO-8601. (`YYYYMMDD`)
- `YYYY` 4-digit year
- `MM` 2-digit month (with leading zeros < 10)
- `DD` 2-digit day (with leading zeros if < 10)
- example:
  - `20241118` 18-NOV-2024

dateAfter.name: after
dateAfter.description:
after date format in compressed ISO-8601. (`YYYYMMDD`)
- `YYYY` 4-digit year
- `MM` 2-digit month (with leading zeros < 10)
- `DD` 2-digit day (with leading zeros if < 10)
- example:
  - `20241118` 18-NOV-2024

secretScope.name: scope
secretScope.description: scope identifier of the authorization credential

secretRealm.name: realm
secretRealm.description: realm identifier of the authorization credential

secretType.name: type
secretType.description:
type of the authorization credential that is to be managed, *note*:
- `identity` for OAuth2.0/OIDC style secrets
- `plain` for simple username/password style secrets
- `snmp` for v1, v2c and v3c SNMP style secrets
- `ssh` for SSH key-based with optional certificate style secrets
- `token` for RESTful style API authorization style secrets

aggregationUnit.name: aggregate
aggregationUnit.description: unit of measure of the aggregation factor

rackSlot.name: slot
rackSlot.description: number of physical slots in the rack, 1=1U, 42=42U etc.

notificationId.name: notificationId
notificationId.description: one or more unique notifying identifiers to cease, serialized as `notificationId=(29a4feb9-1429-4a63-84e8-dd01989f1ec5,33ab44b4-fe7a-4160-9b5d-6145284b5b57)`

publicationId.name: publicationId
publicationId.description: one or more unique publishing identifiers to unpublish from, serialized as `publicationId=(29a4feb9-1429-4a63-84e8-dd01989f1ec5,33ab44b4-fe7a-4160-9b5d-6145284b5b57)`

requestorId.name: requestorId
requestorId.description: unique identifier of the requesting originator

subscriptionId.name: subscriptionId
subscriptionId.description: one or more unique subscription identifiers to unsubscribe from, serialized as `subscriptionId=(29a4feb9-1429-4a63-84e8-dd01989f1ec5,33ab44b4-fe7a-4160-9b5d-6145284b5b57)`

workflowEngineId.name: workflowEngineId
workflowEngineId.description: unique identifier of the workflow engine

workflowRunnerId.name: workflowRunnerId
workflowRunnerId.description: one or more unique workflow runner identifiers to cease, serialized as `workflowRunnerId=(29a4feb9-1429-4a63-84e8-dd01989f1ec5,33ab44b4-fe7a-4160-9b5d-6145284b5b57)`

regexSearch.name: regex
regexSearch.description:
Flag parameter used to indicate the supplied search phrase should be treated as a Regular Expression (RegEx), *note*: the `RE2` RegEx library is used please review `https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax` for further details.
*example*: searching for currencies ISO code, in this case, containing `EUR`
- query:`EU[[:alpha:]]` result:`found`
- query:`EU[[:^alpha:]]` result:`not found`
*note*: any `'` characters will be automatically escaped to `\'`

undeleteHistorical.name: restore
undeleteHistorical.description: Flag parameter used to restore (undelete) specified historical resource if had previously existed but was deleted, *note*: this only applies to historical records that have not been expunged

deletePredictedOnly.name: predicted
deletePredictedOnly.description:
Flag parameter used to determine to optionally
limit the deletion to generated (predicted) variants only

UnauthorizedError.description: Authentication information is missing or invalid

Accepted.description: bulk data accepted for server-side processing

schema.description: General error message wrapped within HTML webpage
specified identifier value was not found
could not be processed because of conflict in the current state of the resource
specified media type was not found or not supported

TooLarge.description:
- existing bulk data is still being processed, try again in specified `Retry-After` header value (seconds), or
- supplied payload is too large
